utils

Class ScreenCapture

  • java.lang.Object
    • utils.ScreenCapture

  • public class ScreenCapture
extends Object
    A helper class to save the graphical content of any swing or AWT component to individual files.
    Author:
    Istvan Fehervari

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScreenCapture()

      Captures the graphical content of the provided swing JComponent.

      Creates a BufferedImage from a rectangular region on the screen.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScreenCapture

        public ScreenCapture()

    • Method Detail

      • captureImageContent

        public static BufferedImage captureImageContent(JComponent component,
                                                String fileName)
                                         throws IOException
        Captures the graphical content of the provided swing JComponent. The result will be saved to the given file and returned as a BufferedImage. The entire component will be captured to an image.
        Parameters:
        component - Swing component to create the image from
        fileName - name of file to be created. Passing null skips saving.
        Returns:
        the image captured
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during writing

      • captureImageContent

        public static BufferedImage captureImageContent(JComponent component,
                                                Rectangle region,
                                                String fileName)
                                         throws IOException
        Captures the graphical content of the given region of the provided swing JComponent. The result will be saved to the given file and returned as a BufferedImage. The entire component will be captured to an image.
        Parameters:
        component - Swing component to create image from
        region - The region of the component to be captured to an image
        fileName - name of file to be created. Passing null skips saving.
        Returns:
        the image captured
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during writing

      • createImage

        public static BufferedImage createImage(Component component,
                                        String fileName)
                                 throws AWTException,
                                        IOException
        Captures the graphical content of the provided AWT Component. The result will be saved to the given file and returned as a BufferedImage. The entire component will be captured to an image.
        Parameters:
        component - AWT component to create the image of
        fileName - name of file to be created. Passing null skips saving.
        Returns:
        the image captured
        Throws:
        AWTException - see Robot.Robot()
        IOException - if an error occurs during writing

      • captureScreen

        public static BufferedImage captureScreen(Rectangle region,
                                          String fileName)
                                   throws AWTException,
                                          IOException
        Creates a BufferedImage from a rectangular region on the screen.
        Parameters:
        region - region on the screen to create image from
        fileName - name of file to be created or null
        Returns:
        image the image for the given region
        Throws:
        AWTException - see Robot.Robot()
        IOException - if an error occurs during writing

      • writeImage

        public static void writeImage(BufferedImage image,
                              String fileName)
                       throws IOException
        Writes a BufferedImage to a File.
        Parameters:
        image - image to be written
        fileName - name of file to be created
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs during writing

      • resizeImage

        public static ImageIcon resizeImage(Image src,
                                    int width,
                                    int height)
        Resizes the given Image to the provided dimensions.
        Parameters:
        src - the source image
        width - the new width
        height - the new height
        Returns:
        the resized image
